anchor.surface_text: These are appeals by leave granted by the High Court of Bombay under article 133 1  c  of the Constitution against its companymon judgment

facts.text: Short point is whether the Bombay Taluqdari Tenure Abolition Act, 1949 is valid in law

anchor.surface_text: is whether the Bombay Taluqdari Tenure Abolition Act, 1949,  hereinafter referred to as the Act  is valid in law.

facts.text: Impugned Act for abolishing Taluqdari tenures in Bombay

anchor.surface_text: The impugned Act, as its very name indicates, was for the purpose of abolishing Taluqdari tenures in Bombay.

facts.text: Section 3 of the Act enacts that with effect from the date on which the Act was to companye into force the taluqdari tenure shall be deemed to have been abolished

anchor.surface_text: Under section 5 1  a  all taluqdari lands are and shall be liable to the payment of land revenue in accordance with the provisions of the Bombay Land Revenue Code

facts.text: Under section 6 all items of property comprised within taluqdari vest in Government and rights of taluqdar extinguished

anchor.surface_text: Under section 6, broadly stated, all the items of property which are companyprised within the taluqdari and belong to the taluqdar vest in the Government as its property

What article 31-B protects is not a mere contravention of the provisions of Part III of the Constitution but an attack on the grounds that the impugned Act is inconsistent with or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by any provisions of this Part.
The appeals must, therefore, be dismissed with companyts.
